question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: ensure_result_state_summary()] [State summary consistency] Does ensure_result_state_summary() validate that the returned summary matches result_state(), or can they diverge? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Atomicity of initialization] Can the three-phase initialization (execution, checkpoint, ledger_update) be interrupted, leaving PartialStateComputeResult in a partially-initialized state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [Transaction boundary] If StateComputeResult creation fails partway through, can this leave the PartialStateComputeResult in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Chunk atomicity] Is ExecutedChunk processing atomic, or can a chunk be partially applied to state causing rollback issues? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: has_reconfiguration()] [False reconfiguration] Can has_reconfiguration() return true when no actual reconfiguration occurred, causing validators to prematurely change epoch? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: has_reconfiguration()] [Missed reconfiguration] Can has_reconfiguration() return false when a reconfiguration did occur, causing validators to miss epoch transitions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs and partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Reconfiguration coordination] When has_reconfiguration() is true, what ensures ExecutedChunk.ledger_info_opt contains the correct new validator set? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: has_reconfiguration()] [Reconfiguration timing] Can the timing of when has_reconfiguration() is checked versus when next_epoch_state is actually used cause race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Byzantine validator] Can a Byzantine validator construct ExecutedChunk with valid signatures in ledger_info_opt but invalid state in output, bypassing consensus checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [State divergence] Can Byzantine validators create different PartialStateComputeResult instances for the same block, causing honest validators to diverge? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/executed_chunk.rs] [Struct: ExecutedChunk] [Signature forgery] Can a Byzantine validator provide an ExecutedChunk with forged signatures in ledger_info_opt that appear valid but represent different state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new_empty()] [Empty block spam] Can Byzantine validators spam empty blocks using new_empty(), causing storage bloat and slowing down honest validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [Clone performance] Does cloning execution_output, state_checkpoint_output, and ledger_update_output in get_complete_result() create performance bottlenecks exploitable for slowdown attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: expect_complete_result()] [Panic overhead] Can attackers deliberately trigger the panic in expect_complete_result() repeatedly to cause validator performance degradation? (Low)
